question_text: A 75-year-old woman is evaluated for back pain.A radiograph of the lumbar spine is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The patient's radiograph of the lumbar spine shows a compression fracture of the L1 vertebral body secondary to osteoporosis (Option D). Compression fractures are characterized by anterior wedging associated with vertebral collapse and irregularity of the vertebral end plates. The clinical diagnosis of osteoporosis is based on the presence of a fragility fracture, especially hip or vertebral compression fractures.In another patient's radiograph, asymptomatic vertebral compression fractures resulting in osteoporosis-related height loss and kyphosis are shown. A vertebral endplate depression without loss of vertebral height in upper lumbar vertebrae (unfilled arrows) and severe wedging and height loss of multiple midthoracic vertebral bodies (filled arrows) are shown.
